result.execSummary:
The defendant Leif L Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 454 Days were granted.
03-16-2017 SENTENCE CREDIT CORRECTED TO 444 DAYS

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution for Carroll University ($988.00), Waukesha Police Department ($500.00) has been stipulated to. Restitution for Local Government Property Insurance Fund ($11,432.85) and Liberty Mutual ($810.96), these amounts to be addressed at next Restitution Hearing. All restitution to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision and Probation.
04/14/2017 ISSUE WITH RESTITUTION FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT PROPERTY INSURANCE FUND WAS AGREED ON, AMOUNT TO BE PAID.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Comply with any Mental health assessment, counseling or monitoring deemed appropriate.

No Contact with Katie W. Maintain/obtain employment. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Motion to amend the JOC. Filed by the Defendant.  

06/19/17, per Judge Carter: Court will deny the motion without a hearing as the Department is following current statutes in their application of funds to obligations.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court.   Defendant Leif L Erickson did not appear.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files 2 letters regarding restitution.  State is requesting $11,432.85 in restitution.  Attorney Detert makes statements regarding documentation and request.  Court sets restitution in the amount of $11,432.85 - payable to Local Government Property Insurance Fund.  Amended judgment of conviction to be prepared.
From DOC. To clarify that Count 4 is consecutive to count 1
2ND AMENDED - SENTENCE CREDIT CORRECTED TO 444 DAYS
Review hearing on April 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court.   Defendant Leif L Erickson did not appear.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for oral ruling regarding restitution.  Court finds that City of Waukesha Police Department is owed restitution for incident at Newhall Drive addresss on date of incident.  Court finds that they are not entitled to restitution for incidents at Oakdale and Sunset Drive.  Court requests the insurance company to submit figures regarding this ruling.  Attorney Detert expresses concerns over what damage ocurred to squad cars at which location.  State will try to help out with this issue.  Court sets further review date to review this issue.  Review hearing scheduled for April 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Received on 03/06/17, from the DOC, requesting review of JOC with regard to jail credit.

03/16/17,   per Judge Carter: The JOC should be corrected to identify 444 days of sentence credit.

Dated 02/03/17, from DOC to Judge Carter, requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered for count 8.

03/03/17, per Judge Carter: The court docket notes do indicate that count 8 was to be concurrent to count 4 but consecutive to count 1, which was apparently not noted in the JOC.  The JOC does reflect that ct. 4 is consecutive to count 1, but this also needs to be spelled out with count 8.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court.   Defendant Leif L Erickson did not appear.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caes called for restitution hearing.  Anne-Marie F. from Local Government Property Insurance Fund appears, representing City of Waukesha Police Department.   Attorney Detert does not dispute the amount being requested, he is disputing whether restitution can be ordered to be paid by the Defendant to the insurance company for reasons stated on the record.  Amount being requested in $11,432.85 (2 squad cars' damages).  Court will take matter under advisement and issue an oral ruling.  No appearance needed by Defendant, nor representative from insurance company.  Oral ruling scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leif L Erickson in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the amended PSI report filed.  Parties make corrections on the record.  Victims rights have been complied with.  Attorney Hulgaard shows a video to the Court.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant's aunt makes statements.  Attorney Detert makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count 1

Sentence of:

8 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 454 days).  Commences immediately.

4 Years of Initial Confinement

4 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

Mental health assessment:   counseling/monitoring 

Take all medications as prescribed; notify agent of prescriptions

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Katie Wiedenbeck.
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;  No alcohol and/or drugs unless prescribed

To have no contact with any known locations where illegal drugs are stored or sold

Maintain/Obtain employment;

Restitution: $988.00 Carroll University; $500.00 to Waukesha Police Department; These restitution amounts have been stipulated to.  

$11,432.85 to the Local Government Property Insurance Fund; $810.96 Liberty Mutual to be paid as a condition of exended supervision :  These restitution amounts are contested, hearing set.  

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

*******************************************************************

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment 

1 1/2 Years of Initial Confinement

1 1/2 Years of Extended Supervision

2 years probation

Conditions of probation / extended supervision:

Mental health assessment:   counseling/monitoring 

Take all medications as prescribed; notify agent of prescriptions

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Katie Wiedenbeck.

To have no contact with any known locations where illegal drugs are stored or sold

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended probation

DNA Surcharge:  Waived

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

*******************************************************************

Defendant Leif L Erickson in court, in custody, with Attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files a 2nd amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #1 & 4 on 2nd amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #8 on 2nd amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1, 4 and 8 on 2nd amended information.  Repeater enhancers are struck on Counts #1 & 4.  Counts #2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 9 and 10 are dismissed and read-in.  Parties request presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation and sets sentencing date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 07:45 am.

Defendant Leif L Erickson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.   City of Waukesha Police Officer Nicholas Hendriksen sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Hulgaard.  Exhibit # 1 marked, offered and video has been played for the Court.  Cross examination by Attorney Bricco.  Exhibit # 1 received.   State rests and moves for bind over.  Closing statements from Attorney Bricco and moves to dismiss count 3.    Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Bail motion to be heard before Judge Carter at the next hearing.  Attorney Hulgaard is on notice.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
